Elizabeth: Thank you for 
helping me with Alison last night.
Stephen: Of course.

Elizabeth: I can't believe that 
I have just given up millions and millions of dollars and I don't even care

Stephen: Hopefully in good 
ways.

Elizabeth: Wonderful ways. I 
just wish I could figure out why I get so sick sometimes, though. I mean, it's 
really hard to explain. It's like I'm -- like I'm hungry for something.

Stephen: Well, I told you, you 
know, I'm flying in a specialist to give you a complete examination.
Elizabeth: Hmm. When?

Stephen: Soon. In the meantime, 
you just keep drinking the water. It'll make you feel better, ok?

Elizabeth: Mm-hmm. Hey, hey, 
hey, hey. Are you going to be long?
Stephen: Excuse me?
Elizabeth: Here, playing?

Stephen: Playing? No. This is 
working. This is my work.

Elizabeth: I mean -- that's 
what I meant. I was just hoping that, you know, we could spend the day together, 
just the --

Stephen: What did I just say to 
you? Didn't I just say I'm working?
Elizabeth: Yes, you did. Sorry.

Stephen: Hey, look, I'm sorry I 
yelled at you, you know. The music's important.

Elizabeth: Oh, I know. I know 
it is. I shouldn't have said anything like -- I just keep finding it so hard to 
keep my hands off of you.

Stephen: The sooner I get 
started, the sooner I'll get done.

Elizabeth: I guess you're 
right. Well, get started. Get started. I'll see you soon.

Stephen: Don't forget -- if you 
start feeling --

Elizabeth: I know, I know. It 
always works.
Stephen: Good.
Elizabeth: See you. Bye.

Jamal: Ok, all right.

[Lucy gasps]
Lucy: Oh, hi.

Kevin: I'm sorry. I didn't mean

Lucy: No, morning. No, I'm -- 
I'm fine. Good morning.

Kevin: Must be hard to get used

Lucy: This is where you belong. 
This is your home.

Kevin: I'd like to walk down by

Kevin: I will go get some

Lucy: Ok.

Ian: Good morning, Lucy. I hope

Elizabeth: Who is it?
[Knock]
Elizabeth: For pete's sakes.

Livvie: Ahem. Um -- hi. My name

Livvie: Thank you. You know,

Elizabeth: And you're here

Livvie: Alison and I, we sort

Elizabeth: I was wondering how

Livvie: Yes, of course I did. 
That's why I was hoping that you would help me.

Elizabeth: I would help you? I

Livvie: Ok, I admit it -- you 
caught me. I'm not here to talk about Alison at all.

Elizabeth: Thank you. I 
appreciate your honesty. Now get out.

Livvie: I'm actually here to 
talk to you about Stephen Clay.

Ricky: Hey, hey, hey. Ha-ha.

I'm sorry I'm late, but I do have those lyrics that you were wanting.

Lucy: Ian? Hi.

Lucy: Yeah. I'm -- I'm fine.

Kevin: I know you're

Ian: You're not really buying

Elizabeth: I know all about

As far as I'm concerned, you are as crazy as everyone says you are. What do you

Livvie: Excuse me?

Elizabeth: Stephen. You want 
him all to yourself. You want to sleep with him, just like the thousands of

Livvie: What, is that how you 
two met?
Elizabeth: What did you say?

Livvie: Well, if Stephen Clay 
can have any woman he wants, why on earth would he choose you?

Elizabeth: Oh. So that's your

Marissa: Excuse me -- "they 
stink"?

Stephen: These lyrics aren't

Marissa: But I didn't think 
they were that bad, Stephen.

Stephen: Do you even listen to

Marissa: Yes, I thought -- I -- 
I don't know. I don't know --

Stephen: I gave you a very 
specific assignment. I told you I wanted a song about a man who can't stay away

Marissa: All righ Stephen. Ok,

Stephen: You're distracted. I 
don't have your full attention.

Marissa: No, no, that's not

Stephen: You have to live and

Jamal: I thought you already
